fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom
Class DicomReader

Object
  ImageReader
      DicomReader

public class DicomReader
extends ImageReader

The DICOM decoder.

Instances of DicomReader are created using DicomReaderSpi.

Possible inputs are :

  • ImageInputStream
    • for reading either part 10 dicom files, or datasets without the part 10 header and encoded with the little-endian implicit transfer syntax.
  • StorageSCP
    • for reading any dicom object received by the local Storage SCP (synchronous listening).
  • ReceivedObject
    • for reading a dicom object received by the local Storage SCP (asynchronous listening) or Query/Retrieve SCU (C-GET).

Dicom objects containing no pixel data may be read by calling getDicomMetadata() after setting the input, and without calling image-specific methods like read.

When reading pixel data, the rasters returned by readRaster and the images returned by read contain the pixel values before any grayscale transformed (the "stored values"). DicomMetadata.applyGrayscaleTransformations(BufferedImage, int) may be called afterwards to obtain an image suitable for immediate rendering.

Method Detail

setRawValues

public void setRawValues(RawValues rv)
Determines if the attribute values in read objects are kept raw or not.

If set to RawValues.ALL, attribute values of data elements are not decoded. Values can only be read using DicomMetadata.getAttribute(int) and are always returned as byte[], except for sequences that are returned as a Vector of DataSets, and pixel data that are returned as instances of a private class.

If set to RawValues.PIXELDATA, only the value of the PixelData attribute is kept raw. This setting is handy when metadata needs to be processed but pixel data does not need or cannot be extracted.

If set to RawValues.NONE (the default), all attributes are decoded and pixel data can be read as images.

This setting is used only when the reader input is an ImageInputStream. See QueryRetrieveSCU.setRawValues(fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom.RawValues) and StorageSCP.setRawValues(fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom.RawValues) for data sets received using the DICOM Storage service classes.

setRawMode

public void setRawMode(boolean b)
Deprecated. Use setRawValues(fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom.RawValues) instead.

getFileMetaElements

public DataSet getFileMetaElements()
                            throws IOException
Returns the File Meta Elements. The File Meta Elements (group 0002 elements) are part of the DICOM file header and contain information on the encapsulated Data Set. Do not call this method if the input of this reader is not an ImageInputStream to a DICOM file. This method returns null if no header can be found in the stream.

Throws:
IOException

readAsRenderedImage

public RenderedImage readAsRenderedImage(int imageIndex,
                                         ImageReadParam param)
The pixel data of the RenderedImage returned by this method will be read only when needed (lazy read). Referenced to such RenderedImage could thus be kept without cloging the memory with pixel data. This DicomReader is used to read the pixel data each time RenderedImage.getTile(int, int) or RenderedImage.getData() is called. Care must be taken to not dispose or change the input of this DicomReader as long as such RenderedImage can be used. Exceptions thrown when reading the image are caught and a null or 0 value is returned by the RenderedImage method that triggered the read.

Overrides:
readAsRenderedImage in class ImageReader
